title: Boris Johnson plays down scale of cuts to the Met Police
text:
Boris Johnson appeared to clash with London's police commissioner today over spending cuts.
Boris Johnson seen during his tour of Tokyo Credit: PA The mayor challenged Sir Bernard Hogan-Howe's warning of 8,000 police officers under threat.
The commissioner questioned the force's ability to respond to a terror attack in the face of an £800m budget cut.
I genuinely worry about the safety of London.
– SIR BERNARD HOGAN-HOWE, Met Commissioner Metropolitan Police Commissioner Sir Bernard Hogan-Howe Credit: PA But the mayor suggested the threat to police numbers was far less severe.
I don't happen to think that we are going to see cuts of anything like the order that he is warning about but it is up to us to make the case for London and that's what we are going to do in the course of the next few weeks.
– BORIS JOHNHSON MP, MAYOR OF LONDON The Met is also considering a plan to axe more than 1,000 community support officers in a bid to save money.
Last updated Thu 15 Oct 2015 Politics London
